@description.name: @description
@description.body: This is the base class for all widgets. External Documentation Documentation of this widget in the qooxdoo manual. NOTE: Instances of this class must be disposed of after use

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired after the widget appears on the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired after the widget disappears from the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired after the creation of a child control. The passed data is the newly created child widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired on resize (after layout) of the widget. The data property of the event contains the widget's computed location and dimension as returned by {@link qx.ui.core.LayoutItem#getBounds}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired on move (after layout) of the widget. The data property of the event contains the widget's computed location and dimension as returned by {@link qx.ui.core.LayoutItem#getBounds}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired after the appearance has been applied. This happens before the widget becomes visible, on state and appearance changes. The data field contains the state map. This can be used to react on state changes or to read properties set by the appearance.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the mouse cursor moves over the widget. The data property of the event contains the widget's computed location and dimension as returned by {@link qx.ui.core.LayoutItem#getBounds}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the mouse cursor enters the widget. Note: This event is also dispatched if the widget is disabled!

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the mouse cursor leaves widget. Note: This event is also dispatched if the widget is disabled!

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Mouse button is pressed on the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Mouse button is released on the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Widget is clicked using left or middle button. {@link qx.event.type.Mouse#getButton} for more details.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Widget is clicked using a non primary button. {@link qx.event.type.Mouse#getButton} for more details.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Widget is double clicked using left or middle button. {@link qx.event.type.Mouse#getButton} for more details.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Widget is clicked using the right mouse button.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired before the context menu is opened.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the mouse wheel is used over the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if a touch at the screen is started.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if a touch at the screen has ended.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired during a touch at the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if a touch at the screen is canceled.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when a pointer taps on the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when a pointer holds on the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when a pointer taps twice on the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when a pointer swipes over the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when two pointers performing a rotate gesture on the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when two pointers performing a pinch in/out gesture on the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when an active pointer moves on the screen (after pointerdown till pointerup).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when an active pointer moves on the screen or the mouse wheel is used.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if a pointer (mouse/touch/pen) moves or changes any of it's values.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if a pointer (mouse/touch/pen) hovers the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if a pointer (mouse/touch/pen) leaves this widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if a pointer (mouse/touch/pen) button is pressed or a finger touches the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if all pointer (mouse/touch/pen) buttons are released or the finger is lifted from the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if a pointer (mouse/touch/pen) action is canceled.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event if fired if a keyboard key is released.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event if fired if a keyboard key is pressed down. This event is only fired once if the user keeps the key pressed for a while.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event is fired any time a key is pressed. It will be repeated if the user keeps the key pressed. The pressed key can be determined using {@link qx.event.type.KeySequence#getKeyIdentifier}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event is fired if the pressed key or keys result in a printable character. Since the character is not necessarily associated with a single physical key press, the event does not have a key identifier getter. This event gets repeated if the user keeps pressing the key(s). The unicode code of the pressed key can be read using {@link qx.event.type.KeyInput#getCharCode}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The event is fired when the widget gets focused. Only widgets which are {@link #focusable} receive this event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The event is fired when the widget gets blurred. Only widgets which are {@link #focusable} receive this event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: When the widget itself or any child of the widget receive the focus.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: When the widget itself or any child of the widget lost the focus.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: When the widget gets active (receives keyboard events etc.)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: When the widget gets inactive

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the widget becomes the capturing widget by a call to {@link #capture}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if the widget looses the capturing mode by a call to {@link #releaseCapture} or a mouse click.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired on the drop target when the drag&drop action is finished successfully. This event is normally used to transfer the data from the drag to the drop target. Modeled after the WHATWG specification of Drag&Drop: http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#dnd

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired on a potential drop target when leaving it. Modeled after the WHATWG specification of Drag&Drop: http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#dnd

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired on a potential drop target when reaching it via the pointer. This event can be canceled if none of the incoming data types are supported. Modeled after the WHATWG specification of Drag&Drop: http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#dnd

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired during the drag. Contains the current pointer coordinates using {@link qx.event.type.Drag#getDocumentLeft} and {@link qx.event.type.Drag#getDocumentTop} Modeled after the WHATWG specification of Drag&Drop: http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#dnd

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Initiate the drag-and-drop operation. This event is cancelable when the drag operation is currently not allowed/possible. Modeled after the WHATWG specification of Drag&Drop: http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#dnd

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired on the source (drag) target every time a drag session was ended.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the drag configuration has been modified e.g. the user pressed a key which changed the selected action. This event will be fired on the draggable and the droppable element. In case of the droppable element, you can cancel the event and prevent a drop based on e.g. the current action.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the drop was successfully done and the target widget is now asking for data. The listener should transfer the data, respecting the selected action, to the event. This can be done using the event's {@link qx.event.type.Drag#addData} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Padding of the widget (top)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Padding of the widget (right)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Padding of the widget (bottom)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Padding of the widget (left)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The 'padding' property is a shorthand property for setting 'paddingTop', 'paddingRight', 'paddingBottom' and 'paddingLeft' at the same time. If four values are specified they apply to top, right, bottom and left respectively. If there is only one value, it applies to all sides, if there are two or three, the missing values are taken from the opposite side.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The z-index property sets the stack order of an element. An element with greater stack order is always in front of another element with lower stack order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The decorator property points to an object, which is responsible for drawing the widget's decoration, e.g. border, background or shadow. This can be a decorator object or a string pointing to a decorator defined in the decoration theme.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The background color the rendered widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The text color the rendered widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The widget's font. The value is either a font name defined in the font theme or an instance of {@link qx.bom.Font}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Mapping to native style property opacity. The uniform opacity setting to be applied across an entire object. Behaves like the new CSS-3 Property. Any values outside the range 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque) will be clamped to this range.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Mapping to native style property cursor. The name of the cursor to show when the pointer is over the widget. This is any valid CSS2 cursor name defined by W3C. The following values are possible crossbrowser:

  • default
  • crosshair
  • pointer
  • move
  • n-resize
  • ne-resize
  • e-resize
  • se-resize
  • s-resize
  • sw-resize
  • w-resize
  • nw-resize
  • nesw-resize
  • nwse-resize
  • text
  • wait
  • help

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the tooltip instance to use for this widget. If only the tooltip text and icon have to be set its better to use the {@link #toolTipText} and {@link #toolTipIcon} properties since they use a shared tooltip instance. If this property is set the {@link #toolTipText} and {@link #toolTipIcon} properties are ignored.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The text of the widget's tooltip. This text can contain HTML markup. The text is displayed using a shared tooltip instance. If the tooltip must be customized beyond the text and an icon {@link #toolTipIcon}, the {@link #toolTip} property has to be used

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The icon URI of the widget's tooltip. This icon is displayed using a shared tooltip instance. If the tooltip must be customized beyond the tooltip text {@link #toolTipText} and the icon, the {@link #toolTip} property has to be used.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Controls if a tooltip should shown or not.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Forces to show tooltip when widget is disabled.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Controls the visibility. Valid values are:

  • visible: Render the widget
  • hidden: Hide the widget but don't relayout the widget's parent.
  • excluded: Hide the widget and relayout the parent as if the widget was not a child of its parent.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget is enabled. Disabled widgets are usually grayed out and do not process user created events. While in the disabled state most user input events are blocked. Only the {@link #pointerover} and {@link #pointerout} events will be dispatched.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget is anonymous. Anonymous widgets are ignored in the event hierarchy. This is useful for combined widgets where the internal structure do not have a custom appearance with a different styling from the element around. This is especially true for widgets like checkboxes or buttons where the text or icon are handled synchronously for state changes to the outer widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Defines the tab index of an widget. If widgets with tab indexes are part of the current focus root these elements are sorted in first priority. Afterwards the sorting continues by rendered position, zIndex and other criteria. Please note: The value must be between 1 and 32000.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget is focusable e.g. rendering a focus border and visualize as active element. See also {@link #isTabable} which allows runtime checks for isChecked or other stuff to test whether the widget is reachable via the TAB key.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: If this property is enabled, the widget and all of its child widgets will never get focused. The focus keeps at the currently focused widget. This only works for widgets which are not {@link #focusable}. This is mainly useful for widget authors. Please use with caution!

@description.name: @description
@description.body: If this property if enabled, the widget and all of its child widgets will never get activated. The activation keeps at the currently activated widget. This is mainly useful for widget authors. Please use with caution!

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget acts as a source for drag&drop operations

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget acts as a target for drag&drop operations

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget contains content which may be selected by the user. If the value set to true the native browser selection can be used for text selection. But it is normally useful for forms fields, longer texts/documents, editors, etc.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to show a context menu and which one

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the native context menu should be enabled for this widget. To globally enable the native context menu set the {@link #nativeContextMenu} property of the root widget ({@link qx.ui.root.Abstract}) to true.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The appearance ID. This ID is used to identify the appearance theme entry to use for this widget. This controls the styling of the element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget should print out hints and debug messages

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to throw an error on focus/blur if the widget is unfocusable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the widget, which contains the given DOM element.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: element {Element} The DOM element to search the widget for.
@param.description: The DOM element to search the widget for.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
considerAnonymousState {Boolean?false} If true, anonymous widget
   will not be returned.
@param.description:
If true, anonymous widget
   will not be returned.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget} The widget containing the element.
@return.description: The widget containing the element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the "parent" widget contains the "child" widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: parent {qx.ui.core.Widget} The parent widget

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.Widget} The child widget

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether one of the "child"'s parents is "parent"
@return.description: Whether one of the "child"'s parents is "parent"

@description.name: @description

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the recommended/natural dimensions of the widget's content. For labels and images this may be their natural size when defined without any dimensions. For containers this may be the recommended size of the underlying layout manager. Developer note: This can be overwritten by the derived classes to allow a custom handling here.

@return.name: @return

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the computed height for the given width.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: width {Integer} Incoming width (as limitation)

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} Computed height while respecting the given width.
@return.description: Computed height while respecting the given width.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the sum of the widget's padding and border width.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} Contains the keys top, right, bottom and left. All values are integers.
@return.description: Contains the keys top, right, bottom and left. All values are integers.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the widget's computed inner size as available through the layout process. This function is guaranteed to return a correct value during a {@link #resize} or {@link #move} event dispatch.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} The widget inner dimension in pixel (if the layout is valid). Contains the keys width and height.
@return.description: The widget inner dimension in pixel (if the layout is valid). Contains the keys width and height.

@description.name: @description

@param.name: @param

{qx.bom.element.AnimationHandle} The animation handle to react for
   the fade animation.

The animation handle to react for
   the fade animation.

{qx.bom.element.AnimationHandle} The animation handle to react for

The animation handle to react for

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Detects if the widget and all its parents are visible. WARNING: Please use this method with caution because it flushes the internal queues which might be an expensive operation.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true, if the widget is currently on the screen
@return.description: true, if the widget is currently on the screen

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create the widget's content HTML element.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.html.Element} The content HTML element
@return.description: The content HTML element

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the content element. The style properties position and zIndex are modified from the Widget core. This function may be overridden to customize a class content.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.html.Element} The widget's content element
@return.description: The widget's content element

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the element wrapper of the widget's content element. This method exposes widget internal and must be used with caution!

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.html.Element} The widget's content element
@return.description: The widget's content element

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all children, which are layout relevant. This excludes all widgets, which have a {@link qx.ui.core.Widget#visibility} value of exclude.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget[]} All layout relevant children.
@return.description: All layout relevant children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Marks the layout of this widget as invalid and triggers a layout update. This is a shortcut for qx.ui.core.queue.Layout.add(this);.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the cache for children which should be laid out.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns whether the layout has children, which are layout relevant. This excludes all widgets, which have a {@link qx.ui.core.Widget#visibility} value of exclude.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the layout has layout relevant children
@return.description: Whether the layout has layout relevant children

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the widget which contains the children and is relevant for laying them out. This is from the user point of view and may not be identical to the technical structure.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget} Widget which contains the children.
@return.description: Widget which contains the children.

@type.name: @type

{Array} Placeholder for children list in empty widgets.
     Mainly to keep instance number low.

The children array (Arrays are

@description.body: Enables pointer event capturing. All pointer events will dispatched on this widget until capturing is disabled using {@link #releaseCapture} or a pointer button is clicked. @description.name: @description
@description.body:
Computes the location of the content element in context of the document dimensions. Supported modes:

  • margin: Calculate from the margin box of the element (bigger than the visual appearance: including margins of given element)
  • box: Calculates the offset box of the element (default, uses the same size as visible)
  • border: Calculate the border box (useful to align to border edges of two elements).
  • scroll: Calculate the scroll box (relevant for absolute positioned content).
  • padding: Calculate the padding box (relevant for static/relative positioned content).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: mode {String?box} A supported option. See comment above.
@param.description: A supported option. See comment above.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} Returns a map with left, top, right and bottom which contains the distance of the element relative to the document.
@return.description: Returns a map with left, top, right and bottom which contains the distance of the element relative to the document.
